loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: As of today, mostly people already feel the hardship of life and poor living. Roberto, aged 48, can’t deny that, and his family experiences the poor quality of living. So he doubles his effort to develop his farming business. But as of now, he suffers from inadequate capital to continue his farming business. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in his farmland. Roberto hopes for a great improvement in his business as he accesses his requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen, aged 54, is crop grower who lives in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is married to a humble man, and they have three children — two single children and one married child. 

Pen and her husband primarily cultivate rice on their 2-hectare farmland, which allows her to cover her daily costs. However, the main source of income is generated from a firewood-trading business operated by Pen’s husband. He typically earns approximately 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. Pen’s husband can manage this business well because he has enough tools like a chainsaw and a buffalo-pulled trailer for transporting firewood to the marketplaces.

Last time, Pen bought a plowing machine on credit for completing her farm work on time. And now she has to pay back the outstanding balance. That is why she would like to acquire a loan of 700 USD from HKL and Kiva. She hopes that lenders will give this loan to her so that she can pay back her supplier and completely possess a plowing machine. She hopes that she will be able to improve her business and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for the outstanding balance from the purchase of a plowing machine.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 32-year-old married woman who has been running a business of manufacturing rugs for the past seven years. She is very famous in her circle for offering various designs of rugs. Her daughters also help her in the making of the rugs. 

She is in charge of providing her family with bread and butter. She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation. Because of her trust in this institution, she again requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistan rupees to buy raw materials, including good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers. In this way, her business will flourish more and enable her to earn enough to support her family well.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, including good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Tafuta Upate Group

texts.en:
Arafa, who is in her late 30s, is married and has one son who is in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal for about four years now.  She works from 7.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Arafa used the previous loans to buy more bags of charcoal and to pay her son's school fees. She has paid all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her businesses stock. Her dream is to one day be able to sell more bags of charcoal in different areas.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Tafuta Upate,” which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Aretas

texts.en:
Aretas is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Aretas is buying and selling sand and gravel for construction. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of sand and gravel to sell. Aretas has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Aretas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Georges

texts.fr: Georges est un homme de 34 ans, fiancé, père de 02 enfants âgés de 15 mois et 04 ans,l'un d'eux va déjà à l'école.Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale où il gère une mini quincaillerie depuis 09 mois.Son activité étant certe jeune, mais georges grâce à sa qualité de bon commerçant a pu en si peu de temps fidéliser une clientèle considérable, mais qu'il n'arrive cependant plus à satisfaire car son capital ne lui permet guère de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante susceptible de satisfaire la demande croissante.Afin de palier à ce problème, il voudrait ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en diluants,seaux de peintures, tôles et biens d'autres produits de quincaillerie, ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande, mais surtout d'augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en vue d'en faire une grande quincaillerie, mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Georges is a 34-year-old man who is engaged to be married and a father of two children, aged 15 months and 4 years old. One of them is already in school. Georges is a merchant in a district in the capital where he has been running a mini-hardware store for nine months. Although his business is young, he has been able to earn a considerable customer base in so little time, thanks to his skills in commerce. But he no longer manages to satisfy his customers because his capital barely allows him to stock up sufficiently for satisfying the growing demand. 

To alleviate this problem, he would like this loan to stock up on sufficient quantities of thinners, paints, sheet metal, and many other hardware items. This will enable him to meet the demand and especially to increase his sales and consequently his profits.

loans.use: to buy thinners, paints, and sheet metal

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María Concepción de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en su vivienda propia. Ella se gana la vida de la manera que mejor sabe hacer y esta es cultivando maíz y frijol, actividad en la que tiene una gran experiencia y por la cual se ha ganado mucho respeto y admiración de su familia y amigos. María es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora que además de cultivar la tierra se dedica a la venta de verduras en la zona donde reside, esto le ayuda a generar ingresos extra para ayudar en la humilde economía de su hogar. María tiene un sueño y es el de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que se acercó a una agencia de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayude a comprar abono, semillas, fertilizante y demás insumos que le sirvan para poder seguir con su objetivo de ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: María Concepción, age 42, lives with her husband and child in a house the family owns. She earns a living by doing what she knows best, which is farming corn and beans. She has many years of farming experience and has earned the respect and admiration of her family and friends. María is an enterprising, responsible and hardworking woman who sells vegetables locally in addition to her farming. This helps her generate additional income to supplement the humble earnings of her household. María dreams of providing a better quality of life to her family. To help achieve this dream, she has approached INTEGRAL to request a loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, seeds, and other agricultural inputs that contribute to her goal of helping her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Eziel

texts.en: Eziel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Eziel buys and sells dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a stock of dried fish to resell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eziel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Nimfa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Nimfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, 26, is married and has two sons. She is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has run a small furniture shop since 2004 and it is the only source of income for their family. His personal goals are to provide quality education for their children and to expand his furniture shop.  

Her husband believes that the business has potential for growth but is constrained due to lack of finances.  
For that, Salma has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan in order to use it for expanding her husband's furniture shop. 

Salma is hopeful that the availability of the requested loan will greatly contribute towards a substantial increase in her husband's income so that they can lead a better life with dignity.

loans.use: to expand her husband's furniture shop.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita, 44, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Daniel and mother to their children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Estelita oversees operations of their motorized tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorized tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Estelita dreams to be able to provide her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Josefa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Josefa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Josefa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
This is Priscilla, 51, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Gil, a driver. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Priscilla operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also sells charcoal. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Priscilla hopes her business will grow and expand through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Lorilyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lorilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Lorilyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Didier Brice

texts.fr: Didier brice est un jeune homme de 26 ans,célibataire sans enfant.Il est propriétaire d'une salle de jeux vidéos dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère lui même depuis 09 mois.Etant donné la jeunesse de son activité et une croissante considérable de la demande, le capital de ce dernier ne lui permet pas jusqu'à présent de s'acheter des écrans plats et consoles de jeux pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Il sollicite donc ce crédit por pouvoir s'acheter ce matériel de jeux  qui lui permettra de récupérer une partie de sa clientèle perdue et de conquérir à nouveau, ce qui augmentera sa marge bénéficiaire.Il économisera une partie de ses bénéfices pour son activité en vue de l'agrandir et même l'étendre et l'autre l'aidera à subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Didier Brice is a young man, 26 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is the owner of a video arcade in his district in the capital that he has been running for nine months. Given the newness of his business and the considerable growth in demand, his business capital now prevents him from buying flat screens and game console for satisfying his customers. 

So he is requesting a loan to buy this game equipment allowing him to recuperate part of his customer base that was lost and to earn new customers. This will increase his profit margins. He will save part of the profits for his business with the aim of enlarging it and even extending it. The other part of the profits will help him to meet his day-to-day needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy flat screens and video consoles

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Age 54 years, Ny is a widowed mother of ten children living in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Out of her ten children, she still has four children dependent on her and they are still in school, while the others have their own employment. To support her big family, Ny has been farming rice and planting cassava for twenty-five years in the village. The current business earns her about 34,500 KHR per day. 

Ny’s group consists of two members and she is the leader of this group. She is a ninth cycle client while her member is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her family and business, and also to afford to buy cows for her family to help with farming activities. Now requesting a loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make her living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, 43, lives in a rural area of the Bakan district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married with three children, one daughter and two sons. Of the three children, one is dependent on her and still in school. The main source of her family’s income is rice farming on 4.5 hectares of farmland. Kim and her family have been in this business for two years to support their living. Their business meets difficulties when insects destroy their crops.

This is Kim’s first micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Kim, as a group leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and use a portion of it to buy pesticides for protecting her paddy-field from insects. She hopes after this loan her crops can produce a good and higher yield than last year so that she can sell the products for more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Pheap is a 50-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are dependents while the others have their own employment. She is a paid worker in the village to make a living while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 49,300 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 11,000 KHR each day.

Pheap’s group consists of two female members, and they both have been with VisionFund for three cycles. They completely paid back the previous loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Pheap will use her portion to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to increase the family’s income because of the new motorbike and save some costs on maintenance.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn  is 41  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Merlyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ayur

texts.en: Ayur, 41 sells second-hand clothes with his wife in the front yard of the market. He has been running his business for a decade nonstop and he has had many regular customers. He buys his stock from the second-hand clothes shops and also some households that sell to him. He lives with his wife in a ger district, with the Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns an old house which was built many years ago and it needs some repairs. In winter it has too much heat loss through windows and doors due to the damages to them. So, he uses the coal-fired stove to warm his home and coal costs are high. He decided to replace his windows and doors and believes that the air pollution will not be reduced unless everyone could cut their overall coal usage. He needs about MNT 6.000.000 to cover the cost of new windows and doors, as well covering the costs of hired workers.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new windows and doors, as well covering the costs of hired workers.

loans.name: Jules

texts.fr: Jules a 29 ans, il est marié et a deux enfants. Ses enfants ont 1 et 6 ans et seul le plus âgé va pour le moment à l'école. L'épouse de Jules est revendeuse. Jules possède depuis 3 ans une entreprise de peinture pour auto. Il emploie à ce jour 4 employés. Jules sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES afin d'augmenter son stock en peinture, diluant, vernie et autres produits nécessaires pour la peinture. Il espère que les profits qu'il réalisera lui permettront d'ouvrir un second atelier. Pour sa famille, il aimerait que les revenus de son activité la mettent à l'abri du besoin.
texts.en: Jules, aged 29, is married and has two children, 1 and 6 years old. Only his oldest is going to school right now. Jules's spouse is a retailer. Jules has had an enterprise for painting automobiles for three years. He now employs four people. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase his stock of paints, thinners, varnishes, and other necessary products for painting. He hopes the profits he will make will enable him to open a second workshop. For his family, he would like his business revenues to shelter his family from need.

loans.use: to buy paints, thinners, and varnishes

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en:
Mr. Batzaya, 29 is an electrician and he has just graduated from the technical college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Now he has a plan to work in the mines in the rural areas. He lives with his wife and his parents in a house which is located in the ger district, Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts in the city. 

His house was built in the early 1990’s and there has not been any big repair or renovation since it’s been built. His house has some problems such as heat loss and damage to its roof, inside walls, etc. so that he is planning to make repairs and insulate by using rock wool, cement and foam. Mr. Batzaya thinks his home will be warmer after the wall and roof insulation and a new smart furnace. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on natural gas. The loan Mr. Batzaya is taking will be used to buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.use: To buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Ochirkhuyag

texts.en: Ochirkhuyag, 57, runs an intercity passenger transportation business with his minibus. He has been running his business since last year and previously worked as a driver in the company. He lives with his wife and three sons in the ger district, an area with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Living in the ger is quite difficult and cold in the wintertime. Using coal to get warm in their ger is expensive and pollutes the air. Nowadays, air pollution is the one of the biggest issues in Mongolian cities. This summer he started to build a small family house on his land plot behind his ger. The building has not been completed and he is planning to add insulation to the walls of his new house. But due to a money shortage, he still has not bought the insulation materials. It requires foam, cement and additional materials. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy the insulation materials for his new house walls.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials for his new house walls.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
For the past 25 years Cecilia, a hardworking entrepreneur, has had an ambulant tobacco-vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.

Cecilia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, is requesting a loan of PHP 22000 to buy additional stocks of tobacco for her tobacco business.

She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of tobacco for her business.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana tiene 63 años, está casada con Rafael, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ya todos independientes. Ahora viven ellos solos en la casa que heredó de su madre.
“Durante mis 30 años de experiencia logré sembrar todo tipo de productos”, comenta. Tiene terrenos propios, en los que junto a su esposo y sus hijos, siembra papa, maíz, habas, cebada y trigo. Su edad no es un obstáculo, pues se mantiene fuerte de espíritu, sobre todo porque le gusta trabajar en el campo. Siembra en extensas hectáreas de terreno, gracias a ello comercializa sus cosechas al mercado central de la ciudad de Lima. Ahora está concentrada en sus cultivos de maíz y alverja, los que cosechará dentro de unos días. Fabiana también tienes tres toros con los que realiza el arado de la tierra.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y en todo este tiempo (casi 3 años) logró invertir en sus cultivos y mejorar su producción; por ello promete seguir trabajando de manera puntual como lo estuvo realizando, y además le agrada trabajar en su grupo.
Fabiana invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 40 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “amarilis”, y 400 sacos de fertilizantes naturales (guano de corral).
texts.en:
Fabiana is 63 years old, she is married with Rafael and they have six children who are already economically independent. They now live alone in the house she has inherited from her mother.
She says: “In my 30-years’ experience I have succeeded in planting every kind of product”. She owns her lands, and there she plants potatoes, corn, broad beans, barley and wheat with her husband and her children. Age is not an obstacle for her, as she keeps on being young at heart, mostly because she likes working in the fields. She plants in extensive hectares of land, and thanks to this she sells her harvests in the central market of the town of Lima. She is now focused on her corn and peas crops, as she will harvest them in the next few days. Fabiana also owns three bulls she uses to plough her lands.

This is her 6th loan with MFP and in all this time (almost 3 years) she has succeeded in investing in her crops and in improving her production; for this reason she promises to keep on working in the same punctual way. On top of this she likes working in her group.
Fabiana will use the loan she is requesting to buy 40 sacks of potato seeds of the “Amarilis” variety, and 400 sacks of barnyard guano.

loans.use: To buy buy 40 sacks of potato seeds of the “Amarilis” variety, and 400 sacks of barnyard guano.

loans.name: Reyna Leticia

texts.es: Reyna Leticia de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia. Reyna hace algunos años decidió montar un negocio que generara una fuente de ingresos para poder ayudar a la economía de su familia, por lo que opto por la compra y venta de pollos vivos, negocio que le ah ayudado a empezar a cumplir su sueño de darle a su familia un mejor futuro. Ella es conocida por sus vecinos y clientela como una mujer trabajadora, honesta y responsable que siempre pone su mejor empeño en lo que hace. Reyna confía en Dios y en su trabajo para poder salir adelante en la vida, es por eso que busco ayuda y se acercó a las agencias de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito, el cual le servirá para invertir en la compra de mas y mejor producto (pollos vivos),  para seguir dando un buen servicio y calidad a su clientela que tanto la prefiere.
texts.en: Reyna Leticia is 27 years old and lives together with her family in her own home. A few years ago, Reyna decided to start a business which would generate income so she could help with family's economic situation. She opted to go into the purchase and sale of live chickens, a business which has begun to fulfill Reyna's dream of giving her family a better future. Her neighbors and customers know her as a hard-working, honest, and responsible woman who always puts her best effort into what she does. Reyna trusts in God and in her work to be able to get ahead in life. That is why is she sought assistance and came to the agencies of INTEGRAL to apply for a loan, which will allow her to invest in more and higher quality product (live chickens) and to continue providing good service and quality to her loyal customers.

loans.use: to invest in more and better product (live chickens).

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила уже несколько раз пользовалась кредитными услугами КИВА. Ее бизнес по продаже семян и удобрений постепенно растет благодаря полученным средствам. Людмила осталась довольна тем, какие возможности открыла для нее эта дополнительная финансовая помощь: она смогла увеличить ассортимент видов подкормки для растений и добавила ассортимент ядов для вредителей, при этом уменьшив количество поездок за товаром и снизив затраты на них.  
В этот раз Людмиле необходим кредит в размере 6 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить подкормку для растений и сопутствующие товары.
texts.en:
Ludmila has already used Kiva’s loan services several times. Her business selling seeds and fertilizers has been gradually growing thanks to the funds obtained. Ludmila appreciates the opportunities afforded by this additional financial support: she has been able to expand her selection of plant food and added a line of insecticides while reducing the number of trips required to replenish her stock and thus driving her costs down.
This time Ludmila needs a loan of 6,000 UAH in order to buy plant food and related items.

loans.use: to buy plant food and related items.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Regina hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Grace is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.
Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne, a 32-year-old married mother of three, has been farming rice for 10 years in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Yvonne is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a 57-year-old married mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting one for PHP 15000 to buy items such as snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois de Kandialang Diola créé le 26 Mars 2002 sous le rapport de bon voisinage de ses membres. Leur activité principale est le commerce.
Mme Aminata est l'emprunteur vedette du groupe. Sur la photo, elle est à droite avec un foulard blanc sur la tête. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 garçons âgés entre 23 et 13 ans. Avec ce prêt, elle compte payer 03 balles de tissus basins blanc et des produits pour la teinture des tissus.
Les bénéfices du prêt serviront à aider son mari pour la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of two women is part of the Banc Villageois of Kandialang Diola, created on March 26, 2002 and based on the neighborliness between its members, Their main work involves commerce. 

Ms. Aminata is the featured borrower of the group. In the photo, she is at the right and wearing a white head scarf. She is married and the mother of four boys, from 13 to 23 years old. With this loan, she intends to pay for three bales of white damask cloth and some goods for dyeing cloth. The profit from the loan will be used to help her husband with regard to food, health care, and the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy goods for dyeing cloth

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa tiene 59 años, está casada con Manuel, con quien tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes y ya conformaron sus propias familias. Ahora ellos viven solos en la casa que compraron hace 40 años.
Santa gusta mucho de trabajar en el campo y poder respirar el aire puro. Sus productos principales son: el maíz, cebada y habas, los que siembra en terrenos arrendados. “Durante todo este tiempo no pude comprar mis propios terrenos agrícolas, pero no es tarde y ahora que ya no tengo muchos gastos, compraré mis terrenos”, comenta. El principal es el maíz, ahora lo está cosechando, su secreto es secar el maíz para venderlo seco, así sirve para preparar diferentes aperitivos. De esta manera obtiene mejor precio de venta en el mercado. 

Ella pertenece al grupo “Pueblo nuevo” y este su el séptimo crédito con MFP. Se siente bien trabajando en su banco comunal, donde recibe consejos para mejorar sus cultivos, pues todos son agricultores como ella.
Santa invertirá este dinero en la compra de semilla de maíz, fertilizantes naturales y el pago a los peones que le ayudarán a voltear la tierra.
texts.en:
Santa is 59 years old, she is married with Manuel and they have three children, who are economically independent and who have already formed their own families. They now live alone in the house they bought 40 years ago.
Santa enjoys very much working in the country and breathing fresh air. She mainly produces corn, barley and broad beans, and she pays rent for the lands where she plants her crops. She says: “In all these years I have not been able to buy my own farming lands, but is it not too late and I will buy my lands now that I don’t have so many expenses”. Her best product is corn and she is now harvesting it; her secret is to dry corn and sell it dried, so that it can be used to prepare different appetizers; and in this way she gets the best selling price in the market.

She is a member of the “Pueblo Nuevo” (New Town) Group, and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She feels at ease working with her Communal Bank, where she receives advice to improve her crops, as everyone is a farmer just like herself.
Santa will use the loan she is requesting to buy corn seeds and manure and to pay day laborers that will help her till the soil.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and manure and to pay day laborers that will help her till the soil.

loans.name: Salvador Oswaldo

texts.es: Salvador Oswaldo, vive en su casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él se dedica  al cultivo y comercio de maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad, siembra la semilla, recoge su cosecha y luego pone  a la venta una parte y otra la deja para consumo.  Esta es su principal fuente de ingresos y es así como se gana la vida día con día para ayudar a su familia. Salvador se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él y confían en el producto que comercializa es por eso que tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de  INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como son semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc. y continuar así cultivando la tierra para cosechar el producto  que le permita llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Confía en Dios y su trabajo que obtendrá muy buenos resultados  y podrá lograr su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador Oswaldo lives in his own house with his family.  He grows and sells corn.  Every year he repeats the business activity of planting the seeds, gathering his harvest, and then selling part of the crop.  The other part is for consumption.  This is his main source of income, and it is how he earns a living every day in order to help his family.

Salvador is known for being a hard-working, honest, and very responsible man.  A lot of people give him good references, and they trust the product that he sells.

That is why he made the decision to visit the Intergral offices in order to request a loan.  The loan will allow him to buy basic farming supplies like seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers, etc.  With these supplies he will continue cultivating the land in order to harvest the product that allows him to bring home the daily bread.

He trusts in God and his work that he will get very good results, and that he will be able to achieve his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic farming supplies like seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Racil

texts.en:
Ma. Racil works hard to support her family. She is married and has been operating a clothing sales business in the Philippines for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

Ma. Racil has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bottles of perfume, incense, and a sack of 'monkey bread'

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, a 32-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 20 years she has operated a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as soap, feeds, softdrinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

Juliet has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in the store. She would like to build and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou est cambiste, il échange des billets CFA contre des grosses coupures. A 44 ans, il est père de deux enfants de 7 et 10 ans qui sont tous deux scolarisés. La femme de Kokou est revendeuse. L'activité de Kokou nécessite un capital initial important, c'est dans le but de l'augmenter qu'il sollicite aujourd'hui son second prêt chez WAGES.  Les profits qu'il dégagera lui permettront d'acheter une moto pour faciliter son activité. Il espère à long terme ouvrir un bureau pour attirer plus facilement sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kokou, age 44, is a money broker. He exchanges CFA bills for larger denominations. He has two children ages 7 and 10 who both attend school. His wife is a reseller. 

Kokou’s business requires him to have substantial capital on hand. He is seeking a second loan from WAGES to bolster this capital. 

The profits earned through this activity will allow him to purchase a motorcycle, which will make his work easier. In the long term, he plans to open a fixed location to attract more customers.

loans.use: to bolster the working capital for his money brokerage activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare for the harvest season and purchase pesticides, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is 26 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Gardabani District with his family: his wife – Sevil, his brother, daughter-in-law, and his mother. All family members run an agricultural business. In particular, they have 4 milk cows and produce cheese. The family also owns agricultural land, where greens are grown. They are very hard-working people and take good care of their livestock. They work hard on their plot of land as well to get a good harvest. 

The family members sell produced cheese and harvested greens in Rustavi open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Arif requested a loan for purchasing milk cows. Thus, he wants to expand his dairy farm. He will get more milk and increase cheese production. It will increase the income of the family. With the increased profit, he will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cristina hopes that her business will become bigger, allowing her to enjoy life with simplicity, peace, and good health. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Meriden

texts.en:
Meriden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a computer shop business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computer shop business. Meriden has been in this business for 22 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Meriden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her computer shop

loans.name: Laura Veronica

texts.es: Laura Verónica de 23 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar en una vivienda de su propiedad. Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol desde ya hace un tiempo.  Ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos, pone su mejor esfuerzo en lo que produce para darle a sus clientes un producto de buena calidad. Laura es una mujer trabajadora, honrada y responsable que tiene como objetivo sacar a delante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que sus vecinos, amigos y clientela siempre dan buenas referencias de ella. Es por este motivo y por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia que se animo a pedir un crédito a INTEGRAL  que le ayude a cumplir el sueño de ayudar a su familia, dicho crédito le servirá para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abono, pesticida, etc. que le son necesarios para poder producir una cosecha mejor que los años anteriores y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de buenos productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
Laura Verónica is 23 years old and lives with her family in the home she owns. She works growing basic grains like corn and beans, and has been doing so for some time. Since this is her main source of income, she puts her best effort into her work so that she can give her customers a good quality product.
Laura is a hard-working, honest, and responsible woman whose goal is to provide for her family and give them a better quality of life. That is why her neighbors, friends, and customers always give her good references. For this reason and because she needed to provide for her family, she decided to request a loan from Integral, which helps her realize her dream of helping her family. This loan will be used to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. that she needs in order to obtain a better harvest than previous years, so that she can continue to meet her customers' demand for good products.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new cart for dried fruit selling business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn, a married mother of three children, works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending.  Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her vulcanizing business.

Jenelyn has been able to sustain her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her vulcanizing business.

loans.name: No's Group

texts.en:
No is 54 years old and married with no children. He lives with his wife in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He and his wife earn a living by planting cassava and selling fishes. Together, they can earn about 63,000KHR per day and are able to save about about 27,000KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

No’s group consists of two members living in the same area. This is No's second, and his co-member's sixth, loan with VisionFund. The previous loan he successfully paid back helped his family support their business and improve their living conditions. No is now leading this group to apply for a loan. No will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland as well as more fish for his wife’s business. He hopes to increase his family’s income in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland as well as fish.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Editha works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Editha is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to buy farmlands.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Tumijo

texts.en:
Tumijo works as a rubber worker, with a very minimal wage. Tumijo only works collecting rubber sap, so to pay for the schooling of Daryati is very difficult. Tumijo's family situation is very difficult, because the two brothers of Daryati are mentally disabled.

Currently, Daryati has started school, hoping that her parents can get a Kiva student loan that can meet the cost of her school fees so her parents can later send her younger siblings to school. In the picture, Tumijo, Rawen, and their three children - Daryati and two brothers.

loans.use: To pay educational fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old, married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. Arlene is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for 8 years and has previously borrowed twice from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Daniel De Jesus

texts.es: Daniel de Jesús de 36 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica desde ya hace mucho tiempo al cultivo de maíz y frijol, siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos ya que en las épocas de poco cultivo trabaja como jornalero para poder tener ingresos extra y así no dejar de llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar. Daniel se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, humilde y responsable,  además de ser conocido por vender productos de buena calidad, es por eso que año con año pone su mayor esfuerzo en sus cultivos ya que su clientela siempre espera lo mejor de él. Es por eso que se acercó a las agencias de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayude a la compra de todos los insumos necesarios para poder llevar acabo una nueva siembra, tales como abono, pesticidas, semillas, etc. y de esta forma poder generar los ingresos necesarios para poder darle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Daniel de Jesús, 36, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s been a corn and bean farmer for a long time; it’s his main source of income although during low agricultural season he works as a day laborer in order to earn extra income and continue to provide sustenance for his humble home.

Daniel is noted for being a very hardworking, humble, responsible man in addition to being known for selling good quality products which is why year to year he puts his best effort into the crops since his customers always expect the best from him.

This is why he approached Integral’s agencies to request a new loan that will help him buy supplies needed to produce a good crop such as manure, pesticide, seeds, etc. thus being able to generate funds necessary to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Elenilson

texts.es: José Elenilson de 33 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Se dedica desde ya hace muchos años al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, por lo que tiene ya mucha experiencia en su trabajo, esta es su principal fuente de ingresos pero cuando la época de cosecha termina y hay oportunidad se dedica a la carpintería para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Los vecinos y clientela dan muy buenas referencias de José, lo definen como una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, que siempre pone su mejor esfuerzo en lo que hace para dar a su clientela los mejores productos del mercado. Él tiene como sueño darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para pagar el alquiler de una parcela y comprar semilla, abono y otros insumos para poder cultivar sus productos y darle a su clientela los mejore productos del mercado.
texts.en: José Elenilson, 33, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s been growing basic grains like corn and beans for many years so he has quite a bit of experience in his line of work.  This is his main source of income but when the harvest is in and the opportunity arises he works in carpentry to be able to bring sustenance to his home.  His neighbors and customers give José very good references.  They describe him as a very hardworking, honest, responsible person who always puts his best effort into what he does to give his customers the best products in the market.  His dream is to provide his family with a better quality of life which is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to pay for the lease on a parcel of land and to buy seeds, manure and other supplies to be able to farm his products and give his customers the best market products.

loans.use: to lease farmland and to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mirah

texts.en:
Mirah works as a laborer, earning an uncertain income every month. Mirah has erratic employment that depends on the time of planting and harvesting rice. Mirah's employment makes family life minimal and limited, but Mirah would like Ayu to stay in school so that her children will be useful. Mirah is eager to get the funds through the student loan program to finance Ayu's schooling.

Ayu lives in the village of Grugu, surrounded by rice fields and away from an access road, so it is not reached by rural transport. But Ayu does not become discouraged from staying in school, which she needs to do in order to realize her ideals. She wants to be a professional accountant. Ayu hopes that this loan will ease the burden on her parents. In the picture, Ayu and Mirah her mother.

loans.use: To pay educational fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Rusmadi

texts.en:
Rusmadi works as a farm laborer. He is the father of Joko, who now attends vocational school. Rusmadi's income is uncertain, so family life is very minimal. Rusmadi wants the kids to still have to go to school, for their future. Rusmadi does not want his children to suffer the same fate as him. Due to economic factors, Rusmadi wants to ask for a loan from Kiva through the student loan program. In the picture, Joko and parents (Rusmadi and wife). 

Joko has a strong desire to stay in school. Born as the third of four brothers, Joko once took a year out of school. He worked odd jobs to save for school fees. The assistance of the Kiva student loan program is expected to help Joko to finish school. Joko's ideal is to open his own bike shop.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Wagirah

texts.en:
Wagirah is the grandmother of Eka. She is a grandmother who must feed three grandchildren. Wagirah's income is from her husband's pension. That is enough for the living expenses of Wagirah and her grandchildren every day. Eka hopes to stay in school, and Wagirah wants to follow the student loan program of Kiva. 

Eka is the eldest of three brothers. Already at birth, he was in the foster care of his grandmother. Until now, Eka's cost of living has been borne by his grandfather and grandmother. Eka's parents are divorced. With the student loan program of Kiva, Eka can finish school, so Grandma does not need to use Grandfather's pension money. Eka hopes to finish school directly and work as a bank employee. In the picture, Eka and Wagirah his grandmother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Samijan

texts.en:
Samijan works as a farmer in his village. He has a considerable number of children amounting to seven. With a very low income, he must support his family. Samijan worries that Dewi can not continue her education. Therefore, Samijan is venturing to borrow through the student loan program of Kiva.

To be a professional accountant is the goal of Dewi. She is in her first year at the vocational school. Dewi had fears and worries that she would have to quit school. With the student loan program of Kiva, Dewi hopes to finish school and help her brothers. In the picture, Dewi and Samijan her father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Supini

texts.en:
The mother of Firdaus, Supini, wants him to stay in school. But due to economic factors, she has concerns. The husband of Firdaus's mother works as a farmer with only seasonal work. His daily income is uncertain. It is only enough for food in everyday life. Through the student loan program of Kiva, Mrs. Supini hopes Firdaus can finish his studies at a vocational school. In the picture, Firdaus and his mother.

Firdaus is currently studying at the vocational school. He wants to be a reliable computer technician. With the student loan program of Kiva, he hopes to achieve his goals in order to help his parents and other relatives.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de 37 años de edad, vive en su vivienda propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Se dedica desde ya hace mucho tiempo a la crianza de pollos como su principal fuente de ingresos, pero cuando hay época de cultivos y tiene la oportunidad y los medios para hacerlo también se dedican a la agricultura para poder ayudar a la humilde economía familiar. Roberto recibe ayuda de su esposa que con grandes esfuerzos se dedica a la costura y juntos tienen el sueño de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Roberto se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honesta y responsable que da su mejor esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, por lo que se ha ganado el respeto y la admiración de familia, amigos y en especial de su clientela que siempre lo prefieren. Es por su gran compromiso de siempre entregar los mejores productos, que decidió solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar más pollos y concentrado para que estos sean de la mejor calidad para su fiel clientela. y a su vez la compra de insumos para su terreno y comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas, pesticidas entre otros.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos, 37, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s been raising chickens for a long time now; it’s his main source of income.  When farming season is high and he has the opportunity and the means to do so he also works in agriculture to be able to help his humble family economy.  Roberto’s wife helps him working with much effort sewing and together they dream of providing their family with a better quality of life.

Roberto is characterized by being a hardworking, honest, responsible person who puts his best effort into the work he does which has won him the respect and admiration of his family, friends and especially his customers who prefer him always.  Because of his commitment to always produce the best products, he’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy more chicks and feed so that they will be top quality for his loyal customers.  At the same time, he will buy farm supplies, seeds, manure, insecticide, pesticide and others.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Daryun

texts.en:
Daryun is the parent of Nining, a farm worker whose income is very minimal. Daryun earns just enough income to finance the family's daily needs. Daryun hopes Nining have not to drop out of school, because Nining is the only hope for the family of Daryun. Through the student loan program of Kiva, Daryun has applied for a loan to finance Nining's school fees at the vocational school. In the picture, Daryun and Nining, his daughter.


Nining is a student at the vocational school. She wants to be an accounting professional. However, because of economic limitations, she has a sense of concern that she will quit school, because her parent only works as a laborer. Nining expects that with the assistance through the Kiva student loan program, she can become an accounting professional, which can help the family.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Lindawati

texts.en:
Lindawati, a grandmother who does not work, must make a living from her brothers. Priscillia, one of her grandchildren, is watched by Linda. Because the mother of Priscillia has died and her father has remarried, her father was no longer concerned about the life of Priscillia. Priscillia's grandmother worried about her education, so she applied for loans through the student loan program of Kiva. In the picture, Priscillia and Lindawati her grandmother.
Priscillia lived with her grandmother. She has a fear that her brothers can not help her in school again, and she should quit school. With the student loan program, she hopes to continue her studies to completion.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Jeminem

texts.en:
Jeminem works as a farm laborer, as well as her husband. Because she is just a peasant, and her husband's income with Jeminem's is just enough for everyday family life, Jeminem has an immense hope for Reni. She wants Reni to finish her studies at a vocational school and quickly get a job in order to help her sisters. Jeminem applies for a loan through Kiva of the student loan program to pay for Reni to finish school.

Reni is a vocational school student and lives in a barren area. Reni is very worried about dropping out of school. Because parental income is uncertain, this motivates Reni to be more enterprising and industrious, in order to finish school and get a job according to her ideals as a computer technician. Reni hopes to help ease the burden on parents. In the picture, Reni and Jeminem her mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Wasiyah

texts.en:
Wasiyah is the mother of Restu. Her husband is working as a seasonal farmer. His income is uncertain. It depends on the time of planting and harvesting rice, and even then it is only enough to meet daily needs. Wasiyah as a mother is very worried that Restu cannot finish school. Wasiyah expects to take part in the Kiva student loan program, so that Restu can finish school. In the picture, Restu and Wasiyah his mother.

Restu is a student at a vocational school. His goal is to become a professional computer expert, but he has fear and anxiety about having to drop out of school. With the student loan program, he hopes to finish school.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling live shrimps and crabs in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional shrimps and crabs to sell.

Andresita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Andresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional shrimp and crabs to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa a 42 ans, elle est mère de deux enfants qui ont 13 et 16 ans et qui vont tous les deux à l'école. Le mari d'Akossiwa exerce la profession de revendeur. Akossiwa est depuis 10 ans revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. Elle vend ses produits à domicile. Elle sollicite un prêt chez WAGES afin d'augmenter son stock en produit d'alimentation. Elle compte réinvestir ses futurs profits dans son entreprise. Elle aimerait à l'avenir pouvoir acheter elle même à  l'étranger ses produits en gros et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa, age 42, is the mother of two children ages 13 and 16 who both go to school. Her husband is a reseller. 

Akossiwa has been selling general food products for ten years, working from her home. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to replenish her stock of merchandise.  

She plans to reinvest future profits into her business. In the long term, she would like to travel abroad to buy wholesale. She also wants to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Josué Antonio

texts.es: Josué Antonio es un joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante en la vida, a sus 23 años de edad trabaja junto a su padre, así mismo se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. Con el deseo de salir adelante Josué realiza la actividad de sembrar maíz para posteriormente comercializar, este trabajo lo realiza con su padre, quien le enseño desde  muy pequeño el arte de la siembra.  Josué solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz y de esta forma aumentar la cantidad de producción de maíz, con esto él desea aumentar las ganancias que percibe junto a su padre, ya que esto sería para solventar los gastos familiares como la compra de alimentos, y así mismo para costear sus estudios universitarios, lo cual es una de las ilusiones más grandes que Josué sostiene y así de esta manera tener un mejor futuro para el y su padre.
texts.en:
Josué Antonio is a young man who very much wants to get ahead in life.  At the age of 23 he’s working with his father while also attending university.  Wanting to get ahead, Josué is growing corn for subsequent sale.  He does this work with his father who taught him how to plant when he was a little boy.  

Josué is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy larger amounts of corn thus improving corn production.  He hopes this way to increase the profits he earns with his father to cover family expenses like food purchases while also being able to pay for his university studies which is one of the greatest hopes Josué has thus resulting in a better future for him and his father.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo junto al cual se dedica a trabajar para contar con todo lo necesario en su hogar. 

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de vacas, cabras, cerdos y pollos de engorde, de los cuales comercializa leche, huevos, diferentes tipos de queso, crema y así mismo comercializa sus carnes al venderlas al rastro que es donde se realiza la matanza del animal y luego se distribuye a supermercados, quienes son sus principales clientes y además en el mercado de su localidad. 

Rosa tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este oficio, por lo que es muy conocida, lo que le permite contar con varios clientes fijos. 

Ahora con el deseo de poder aumentar sus ventas, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la esperanza de contar con el dinero necesario para comprar vacas, cerdos y cabras, también alimento y vitaminas necesarias para el fortalecimiento de los animales y así de esta forma mejorar la calidad y  aumentar la producción de leche, productos lácteos y carne, lo que le permitirá renovar y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira  lives with her children and husband with whom she works to be able to have all things they need in their homestead.

Rosa makes a living rearing cattle, goats pigs and poultry to fatten from which she sells milk, eggs, different types of cheese, cream, and she also sells the meat at the markets where they butcher the animal and distributes it to supermarkets, who are her principle clients as well as smaller local markets. 

Rosa's been in the business for 30 years and because of that she is very well know and that allows her to have various regular customers.

Now with the goal to increase her sales she requests a loan with "Integral", with the hope to have the money she needs to buy cattle, pigs and goats and the food and vitamins necessary for the strengthening of the animals and this way improve their quality of life and increase the production of milk, milk products and meat which will allow her to renew and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cows, pigs, and goats as  well as the necessary food and vitimans to raise the animals

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es:
Diana es una joven de 29 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual es una ciudad que recibe muchos turistas en todo el año ya que van a visitar uno de los atractivos turísticos más característicos de la zona, la cual son las líneas de nazca, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, pallar, tuna, cochinilla, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Diana estudio la carrera técnica de computación e informática y gracias a ello inicio su negocio de tipeos, escaneos, impresiones y también la venta de recargas virtuales, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá instalar divisiones de drywall con lo cual construira un pequeño locutorio en su negocio, de esta manera poder tener un ingreso mas y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio mas grande”.
texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old. She lives in the city of Nazca, which is a city that receives many tourists all year round who come to visit the tourist attractions that are characteristic of the area, which are the Nazca lines. The people there work in agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, lima beans, prickly pear fruit, and cochineal, among other things. When she has some free time, Diana likes to eat one of her favorite meals, which is the delicious rice with chicken.

With much hard work and dedication, Diana studied computer, information, and internet systems. Thanks to this, she started a business that does typing, scanning, photocopies, and also sells cell phone minutes. She spends approximately 8 hours per day at her business and she can take tend to up to 15 customers each day. She believes things are going well for her business because she is friendly to her customers and, above all, because she has a great desire to get ahead.

Diana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided that she can purchase drywall to install a small internet business in her home, and in this way have some more income, improve her quality of life, and continue working to make her greatest dream come true: to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy drywall to install an internet business in her home

loans.name: Jesús De Nazaret  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días los 2 socios y las 11 socias  del Banco Comunal Jesús De Nazaret, los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Adriana, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y la menor de  16 años de edad la cual estudian en colegio y es la que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo tiene un taller de soldadura.

Ella es un ama de casa muy trabajadora y para ganar algo por su cuenta trabaja en un local de venta de hamburguesas, trabaja en las tardes y noches y le pagan un sueldo mensual. El crédito es para el negocio de su esposo, el mismo que fabrica muchas obras con el metal como puertas, ventanas, estructuras metálicas, etc. Él trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de dos operarios a quienes  les paga un sueldo mensual, lleva más de 20 años con su taller y siempre ha tenido trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras, pinturas y otros materiales que emplea su esposo para elaborar sus obras. Este es el segundo  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como a sus compañeros.

Su sueño es terminar su casa ya que aún le falta mucho.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The two male and eleven female members of the “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) communal bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo.  They carry out a variety of activities like general commerce and services, among others.

One of the members of this group is Adriana, 48.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children: an adult and a 16-year-old who attends secondary school and is the one still living with them.  Her husband has a welding shop.

She is a very hardworking housewife who in order to earn a little on her own works at a hamburger stand afternoons and evenings and is paid a monthly salary.   The loan is for her husband’s business.  He manufactures a variety of metal objects like doors, windows, metallic structures, etc.  He works Monday through Saturday with the help of two employees who he pays monthly salaries.  He’s had the shop more than 20 years and has always had work.

This loan is to buy metal, welding supplies, paint and other supplies her husband uses to do his work.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they give her and her fellow members.  Her dream is to finish her house which still has a long way to go.

The small photo is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy metal, welding supplies, paint and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rosa Elvires

texts.es: Rosa Elvires, de 26 años de edad vive junto a su esposo de 30 años y 3 hijos en casa propia.  Con mucho esfuerzo los 3 pequeños de Rosa están estudiando en la escuela cerca de su vivienda. Es ama de casa y se caracteriza por ser; una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y sincera. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos  es decir siembra  frijoles y arroz. Y cuando no hay tiempo de cosecha realiza trabajos temporalmente con su esposo, como participar en la corta de caña de azúcar, lavar o planchar para otras personas a fin de nunca falte de comer en su casa. Rosa siente que necesita incrementar sus cosechas ya que tiene un terreno de una manzana ubicado en su casa, es mucho espacio y no tiene las posibilidades de sembrar en el, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar la ayuda y poder comprar insumos agrícolas como lo son: semillas, abonos y venenos  para plagas. Y así ella podrá incrementar más sus cosechas y éstas poderlas vender para lograr cubrir las necesidades que posee, agradece la ayuda que le brindara y espera solventar la deuda adquirida antes de tiempo
texts.en:
Rosa, 26, lives with her 30-year-old husband and their 3 children in their own home. Through much effort, Rosa's 3 children are studying at a school near her house. She is a hardworking, honest, and sincere homemaker. Rosa plants basic grains such as beans, rice, and so forth. When harvest season is over, she also takes temporary jobs with her husband, such as working for others to harvest sugar cane, and washing and ironing for others so that there is always food on the table.

Rosa feels she should increase her harvest, since she has a manzana of land around her house. This is a large area to plant; therefore, she came to INTEGRAL to request help to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. She will then be able to increase her harvests and sell them to cover her household expenses. She is grateful for the help offered to her and expects to pay off her debt early.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Señoras del Taguan, vive por la comunidad de San Bartolome que pertenece al cantón Sígsig, ubicado al Sureste de la Provincia del Azuay, su económica se sustenta en la agricultura, la manufactura y comercio, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables y gentiles que luchan diariamente para mejorar su economía.

Doña María tiene 70 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María pasa en un tratamiento constante ya que sufre de diabetes, agradece a Dios porque todos los miembros de su familia se encuentran por el momento gozando de muy buena salud. 

Ella se dedica a la agricultura y las verduras que cosecha es para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar, también en casa se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, cerdos y ganado, estas actividad es lo ha aprendido desde que tenía una corta edad, le gusta trabajar en esta actividad porque le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando pollos y alimento para sus animales, en la cancelación del mismo se atrasado un poco debido a su enfermedad pero ya realizo la cancelación total. Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y ganado para seguir con su negocio.
 
La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos le dan la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Señoras del Taguan” communal bank and lives in the community of San Bartolomé that belongs to Sígsig Canton located in the southeast of Azuay Province.  Its economy is based on agriculture, manufacturing and commerce.  Its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples and are kind, pleasant people who strive daily to improve their economy.

María is 70-years-old, a widow and has four children who are all married adults living on their own.  The house she lives in his hers.

María is under constant treatment because she has diabetes and she thanks God because all the members of her family are currently enjoying very good health.

She works in agriculture and the vegetables she grows are both to sell and for home consumption.  She also raises chickens, pigs and cattle to sell.  She learned these activities when she was still quite young and likes working in this activity because it’s made it possible for her to cover household expenses and to raise her family.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy chicks and animal feed.  She was a little late in repaying it because of her illness but she’s now totally paid it back.  She will use this loan to buy chicks and cattle to continue with her business.  She likes her communal bank because the loans give her the opportunity to improve her business and her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy chicks and cattle.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Emily has been farming sugarcane for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.
